abstract.text: Constants for the tag schemes specified when initializing a linguistic tagger.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: When initializing a linguistic tagger with

, you specify one or more tag schemes that correspond to the kind of information you’re interested in for a selection of natural language text. To ensure optimal performance, avoid specifying tag schemes that you won’t use.
Some tag schemes are only available for certain units and languages. Use
to determine the possible values for a specified language and linguistic unit.
When working with linguistic tags using the methods described in Getting linguistic tags and Enumerating linguistic tags in
, the returned tag value depends on the specified scheme. For example, given the token “Überraschung”, the returned tag is
tag scheme, and “Latn” (Latin script) when using the
tag scheme, as shown in the following code.

code: tagger.tag(at: 0, unit: .word, scheme: .lexicalClass, tokenRange: nil) // Noun
tagger.tag(at: 0, unit: .word, scheme: .language, tokenRange: nil) // german
tagger.tag(at: 0, unit: .word, scheme: .script, tokenRange: nil) // Latn

abstract.text: Analyze natural language text and deduce its language-specific metadata.
The unique identifier string for the German language.
A tag indicating that the token is a noun.
Constants for the tag schemes specified when initializing a linguistic tagger.
Creates a tag scheme.
Creates a tag scheme with the specified raw value.
A scheme that supplies the language for a token, if it can determine one.
A scheme that supplies a stem form of a word token, if known.
A scheme that classifies tokens according to class: part of speech, type of punctuation, or whitespace.
A scheme that classifies tokens according to whether they are part of a named entity.
A scheme that classifies tokens corresponding to names according to
, and classifies all other tokens according to
A scheme that supplies the script for a token, if it can determine one.
A scheme that scores text as positive, negative, or neutral based on its sentiment polarity.
A scheme that classifies tokens according to their broad type: word, punctuation, or whitespace.
A tagger that analyzes natural language text.
The response to an asset request.
Retrieves the tag schemes available for a particular unit (like word or sentence) and language on the current device.
Asks the Natural Language framework to load any missing assets for a tag scheme onto the device for the given language.
The tag schemes configured for this linguistic tagger.
Train a machine learning model to tag individual words in natural language text.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
